channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Protesters defy curfews across US
Floyd family questions Minneapolis police chief on live TV
item.description: CNN's Sara Sidner stops mid sentence to ask the Minneapolis Police Chief Medaria Arradondo a question on behalf of George Floyd's family. This was the first direct communication the Floyd family has had with the police department.

item.title: A serious divide exists among Trump advisers over how to address nights of protests and riots in US after Floyd's death
Cities extend curfews for another night in an attempt to avoid violent protests over George Floyd's death
Protests erupted in at least 30 cities over death of George Floyd
item.description: Protests erupted in at least 30 US cities over the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis, Minnesota, with violent clashes across the country. CNN's Polo Sandoval reports.

item.title: Christo, who made monumental art around the world, has died at 84
item.description: Christo Vladimirov Javacheff, who was known for his monumental environmental artworks with his late wife, Jeanne-Claude Denat de Guillebon, has died. He was 84 years old.

item.title: Queen Elizabeth goes riding in first appearance since virus lockdown
Sheriff takes off riot gear and joins protesters
item.description: Genesee County Sheriff Chris Swanson spoke with demonstrators who were met by police officers in riot gear and then joined the protest, according to CNN affiliate WEYI.

item.title: National security adviser: 'I don't think there's systemic racism' in US police forces
item.description: National security adviser Robert O'Brien on Sunday denied in an interview on CNN that systemic racism exists across the nation's police forces, arguing instead that "a few bad apples" give the impression of racism among law enforcement officers.

item.title: He covered 1,250 miles in 10 days. When he arrived home, a tragedy happened.
Protester's message for looters: Something is wrong with you
item.description: One protester in Minneapolis said individuals looting during the nationwide protests, in response to the killing of George Floyd, are 'opportunistic' and 'something is wrong' with them.

item.title: Macho leaders are finding the coronavirus immune to their playbooks
WHO releases new guidance for outdoor events
Atlanta mayor on Trump: He should just stop talking
item.description: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms reacts to the way President Donald Trump has been responding to nationwide protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: US astronauts disembark SpaceX's Crew Dragon and board the International Space Station
item.description: Astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley have successfully disembarked the SpaceX Crew Dragon space capsule and entered the International Space Station.

item.title: Demonstrators rally in Europe in solidarity with US protesters
Video shows deputy repeatedly punching woman in head
item.description: An investigation is underway after a Michigan sheriff's deputy was seen on video repeatedly punching a black woman in the head, according to the Washtenaw County Sheriff's Office.

item.title: A guide to how you can support marginalized communities
item.description: The pain felt by black communities after three recent tragedies is all too familiar.

item.title: The first time I realized I was black
There are deep inequities in America: Fareed Zakaria
item.description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria shares his observations on the nationwide protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: The Asian billionaire who made a fortune from war
item.description: When Stanley Ho Hung-sun, the man who made Macao a global gambling mecca, died at age 98 this week he was reportedly worth $14.9 billion.

item.title: How Karen became a meme, and what real-life Karens think about it
item.description: Karen Sun is a far cry from the "Karen" meme that has spread widely over social media in recent years.

item.title: Trump postpones G7 ... and wants to invite Russia, Australia, India and South Korea
item.description: President Donald Trump has announced he is postponing the G7 until at least September and wants to invite four additional countries to the summit: Russia, Australia, India and South Korea.

item.title: How Vietnam kept its coronavirus death toll at zero
item.description: When the world looked to Asia for successful examples in handling the novel coronavirus outbreak, much attention and plaudits were paid to South Korea, Taiwan and Hong Kong.

item.title: The world's new Covid-19 epicenter could be the worst yet
item.description: For months, Latin America watched the rest of the world suffer as the coronavirus spread. It is a spectator no longer.

item.title: Which international destinations are reopening to tourists?
item.description: Although most governments are still advising against "nonessential" international travel, a host of popular destinations are beginning to ease their Covid-19 lockdown measures and border restrictions and are moving toward welcoming tourists back.

item.title: Zookeeper mauled by lions in Australia
item.description: The 35-year-old woman has been hospitalized after being bitten in the head and neck in what one paramedic called an "extremely vicious" attack at Shoalhaven Zoo, according to CNN affiliate 9 News Australia.

item.title: Michelle Obama: It's up to everyone to root out racism
item.description: Non-black folks also need to help root out racism, former first lady Michelle Obama said this week while speaking out over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Partygoer at crowded pool party in Missouri tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: A person who partied at a crowded Memorial Day party in Lake of the Ozarks, Missouri, has tested positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: F1 gets green light to start season with Austrian GP double-header
item.description: The coronavirus-hit Formula One season will finally get underway with the Austrian Grand Prix on July 5, the Austrian government announced Saturday.

item.title: 95-year-old veteran in Ghana raising funds for Covid-19
item.description: Private Joseph Hammond, 95, has been walking through the streets of Accra, Ghana to raise money for frontline workers battling Covid-19. He was inspired by fellow veteran Captain Tom Moore. CNN's Stephanie Bursari reports.

item.title: Hungarian league allows football fans into sparsely populated stadiums
item.description: Hungarian football fans got a taste of what may become the new "normal" as they were allowed into stadiums to watch this weekend's action in the national professional league.

item.title: 'If I watched the video, I still don't believe it's me flying': Sophia Floersch relives horror crash
item.description: It was the 2018 Formula 3 Macau Grand Prix final, and Sophia Floersch had just gone airborne at a speed of 171.6 mph.

item.title: Inside the last of Germany's disappearing nuclear plants
item.description: After an earthquake and tsunami triggered multiple meltdowns at Japan's Fukushima Daiichi power plant in 2011, the shockwaves were felt across the world's nuclear industry. Over 5,000 miles away in Germany, where the use of atomic energy had long been a matter of contention, the incident sounded a death knell.

item.title: Football's restart is a battle of 'money vs. health,' says former Premier League club doctor
item.description: The world's richest football league will return to our screens on June 17.

item.title: Daredevil biker swaps mountains for washing machine stunts
item.description: Most people might look at a washing machine and think it's only got one use.

item.title: 'Space Force' casts Steve Carell in a broad satire that never achieves liftoff
item.description: Reuniting Steve Carell and "The Office" producer Greg Daniels, "Space Force" carries such an impressive payload -- from the star-heavy cast to the concept -- it's a shame the actual show isn't better. As is, this too-broad parody has sporadic moments but consistently feels like it's trying way too hard to achieve liftoff, like an "Airplane!" movie gone wrong.

item.title: Preserved ancient Roman mosaic floor found in Italy
item.description: A well preserved ancient Roman floor has been discovered under a vineyard in Negrar, Italy.

item.title: I was trapped naked on a German fire escape
item.description: It's 10 years ago. I'm on a road trip to Germany with my then boyfriend.

item.title: What's going to happen to dance clubs?
item.description: In nightclubs around the world, once-crowded dance floors have remained empty for months. If you need reminding, clubbing is close contact activity: People share drinks, hug, kiss and generally invade each others personal space until the early hours of the morning.

item.title: Protestors face off with the forces of order in DC and New York, as crowds gather at City Hall in San Francisco
Serious divide among Trump advisers over protests
item.description: A serious divide has emerged among Donald Trump's top allies and advisers over how the President should address several nights of protests and riots across the nation following the death of George Floyd. Trump is being urged by some advisers to formally address the nation and call for calm, while others have said he should condemn the rioting and looting more forcefully or risk losing middle-of-the-road voters in November, according to several sources familiar with the deliberations.

item.title: In a sad week for America, Trump has fled from his duty
item.description: This past week has brought tragedy upon tragedy to our nation: the death toll from Covid-19 passed a grim milestone of 100,000 deaths; the brutal killing of George Floyd ignited mass protests in Minneapolis and beyond, and seven were shot dead demanding justice in Louisville.

item.title: What we do and don't know about US extremists
item.description: Law enforcement and federal officials say outside elements from both far-right and far-left groups are helping fuel the violent and damaging confrontations that have marred protests across the country in recent days, despite President Donald Trump's focus just on Antifa and the far left.

item.title: Trump taken to underground bunker during protests
item.description: As protesters gathered outside the White House Friday night in Washington, DC, President Donald Trump was briefly taken to the underground bunker for a period of time, according to a White House official and a law enforcement source.

item.title: New video shows moments before Floyd was pinned to ground
item.description: George Floyd was pronounced dead after Minneapolis police officers restrained him while he repeated, "I can't breathe!"

item.title: While Trump shelters in the White House, America cries out for leadership
item.description: NYC mayor's daughter arrested at protest

item.title: Queen Elizabeth goes riding in first appearance since virus lockdown
See moment SpaceX Dragon docks
item.description: Astronauts Bob Behnken and Douglas Hurley arrive on the International Space Station from their SpaceX spacecraft, a first in history.

item.title: Hong Kong stocks jump as investors shrug off US-China tensions
item.description: Hong Kong stocks are on pace for their best day since March as investors shrug off the Trump administration's intention to end a special economic and trading relationship with the Asian financial hub. There are also signs in the region that China's economy is continuing to recover from the worst of the coronavirus pandemic.
